intro: Polyscias borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Borneo. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
